fullDescription.intro: In each iteration the node selects a set of rows specified by a window, which defines the output table. The window is either defined by the number of rows it contains, or by selecting a certain time or date interval.
fullDescription.option: The window size and step size are chosen as a number of rows. In each iteration a window will be returned with the exact number of rows as specified by the window size.

The window size and step size are given as duration. If no row lies within the next time window, the window will be moved forward until it at least contains a single row or no rows are left. The chosen time column has to be sorted in ascending order or the node will fail (see 'Sorter' Node) . Note the size of the output table can vary per iteration.

The window size is either defined as the number of rows it contains (row based) or as a duration (time based). Depending on the chosen method the number of rows returned in each iteration are static or variable.

The step size, which is either given as the number of rows (event triggered) or as a temporal amount (time triggered). The step size defines on how the window will move as it either defines the number of elements or the time it will skip after each iteration.
If selected, the sliding window will never overlap with the start or the end of the table. If false, undefined rows will be added as missing values.
If selected, the window will start at the specified date and time. Otherwise, the window will choose the date and time of the first row as a starting point.
Looks window size forward from the current row.
Looks half the window size backward from the current row and half forward.
Looks window size backward from the current row.

ports.inPort: Any input table. Each iteration will process one part of this table.
